variables.tr_resourceName: VNIC without associated network security group
variables.tr_problemDescription: A virtual network interface card (VNIC) is a networking component that enables a resource such as a compute instance to connect to a virtual cloud network (VCN). The VNIC determines how the instance connects with endpoints inside and outside the VCN. Each VNIC resides in a subnet in a VCN. An VNIC with an NSG may trigger a connectivity issue.
